title: A question about Talon's new lore to Rioters, is it a whole change or just improvement?
body:
I'm sorry if it sounds rude. We don't even know if you started working on it! Just wondering if General Du Couteau will still be the breaking point of Talon's lore, or is it gonna be a new bio with a different direction. Sorry again, if i'm asking a question that is not supposed to be asked. And thanks for looking even if it is!

Also to the people who are familiar with Talon's lore, would you like it to be changed and take a different approach to Talon? Or do you think he still should be the boy that grew up in the streets of Noxus and obedient to the General to the end?

replies.body: The goal with every existing champion is "to add and clarify" where possible, as opposed to change. That's doubly true if said champion is not getting a VGU at the time. :-)

I'd love to know more about why Quinn is listed as his enemy on Universe. I imagine it's primarily due to the indirect rivalry they had back when her lore journals were released, but now that those have been more or less phased out of the new canon, I think it'd be interesting to explore their relationship.
I think it's most definitely a relic from the old lore, which has not (yet?) been explained in the newer stuff. Not to say that it definitely will or won't, but it's a good place to start!

Not necessarily asking for it one way or another, but I think it'd be cool to try to preserve oddball relationships from the old lore.  I just think it has a neat flavor when two characters who ostensibly have nothing linking them know each other from that ONE time.  Plus it connects multiple storylines together.

TF/Evelynn, Quinn/Talon, Garen/Katarina (okay I'm actually asking for that last one; not a shipper, just think it has a super interesting dynamic).

Ooh thank you so much for this. I've been keeping track on the issue!

Basically, I agree with what was said. The lore will be modernized as most of Talon's lore and purpose was linked to his 'joining the League to find General Du Couteau', followed by the last Journal of Justice entries (around issue 27), where he effectively investigates the case. Here's a somewhat detailed summary of the conspiracy. [[x]](https://askthebladesshadow.tumblr.com/post/174385763360/and-now-a-picture-of-talons-handwriting)

The Institute of War is gone, and Noxus has a new setting, the High Command is now the Trifarix and according to the snippet released last year for his lore, he currently takes orders from them. 

Talon's loyalty and obsession with his 'cause' are basically the core of his character. Without that, he isn't the champion we know. 

Hopefully, we will learn more about Du Couteau's fate and his situation before disappearing. I think the powerplay between Swain and LeBlanc will be a key factor in this. Was Du Couteau a friend/supporter of Swain? Or was he somehow sided with LeBlanc? 

We have some quotes about this, Urgot states _"I hope your father begged when Swain betrayed him.“_ when taunting Katarina.

And then Swain going  _"Do they know who killed your father, or do they still blame me?”_

And the most confusing one, Swain to Katarina _"He asked her to do what she could not. To kill me.”_



In summary, my guess is the_ modernization_ of the lore will be something like "Talon accepting to work for the Trifarix to discover the shadows responsible for Du Couteau's fate." Either as a payment for his blades (this would lead him to be a sort of mercenary who gets paid in favors/contacts/information instead of gold. 

Or, working for the Trifarix under the conviction he knows he is now serving Noxus in the same way Du Couteau had, to honor his name, finding a new purpose there. This would sort of imply the General's death has been cleared. 


I honestly prefer the first one. 




PS: Lewanor, I know you are in the R/ Talonmains (I'm there too, I remember we went into the Swain AMA asking about this :B)

Yeah, i created this account for the lore talks here! I was really lucky that Lewanor wasn't taken already. I see you all the time anytime Talon's name drops, i am around now so maybe we'll get some more hints!

Also i think Swain had nothing to do with General Du Couteau, he probably discovered the Black Rose with a lot of information so he had to be cleaned. Putting the blame on Swain is not a hard thing, if General was a Darkwill supporter before. Maybe he was a supporter of the REAL Darkwill and started to get suspicious about Darkwill (he was corrupted and was mind controlled like Theoden from LotR) and started to do some digging. And he got killed as result. The only problem i have is General Du Couteau is such a powerful figure in the old lore, and him being a angry assassin trainer in the new lore doesn't fit imo. BUT we only saw him by Kat's eyes, maybe General was under influence of other things? We'll see in time.

My thoughts exactly! It would be really cool he found out Darkwill had become a puppet and yes, you know how it went. 

Tbh, from the Katarina lore, he has some relatively wise teachings for her. I didn't necessarily dislike what we saw of him through Katarina's story. 


> General Du Couteau pushed her to learn the way of the blade; to cut away the empire’s enemies not with reckless brutality, but deadly precision. He was a harsh teacher with many pupils, and notoriously difficult to impress.


---------------

> Katarina’s father himself barely escaped with his life.
> 
> He was furious beyond words, refusing even to look his daughter in the eye. She had shamed him, and their family name. The greatest assassins do not seek recognition or glory, he reminded her. They do not expect to occupy a place of honor at their master’s right hand.


----------------


> And failure must have its consequences. She ran her fingers along the raw, deep gash over her left eye, and thought of the price others had paid for her arrogance.


----------------



In the last part we see her PoV of her father rising others in her place, but as it was mentioned it is a one-sided perspective. Though her dishonor is real, and she is aware of her grave failure. 

It's true the Old Lore General Du Couteau seemed a bit nicer and more compassionate, especially in Cassiopeia's old "judgment".
A bit nicer to Cass, maybe, but not to Talon. Even in Talon's old lore, the General gave him 2 options: Serve or die.

Having him investigate the general's death and thus the black rose could create an interesting dynamic between him and Leblanc! Other champs for interactions that would come to mind are Katarina, Cassiopeia, Swain, Darius, and Quinn! Maybe we could even get a whole new story involving his training under the general, who knows? The possibilities are certainly there and as a talon main I strongly feel him and katarina are due for some kind of in game interactions update and a lore update for Talon!

Given the old lore, Talon's path was meant to cross the Black Rose. It was heavily implied LeBlanc and Swain were responsible for Du Couteau's disappearance. But this was all in the JoJ.

There's also a very amusing hint of Talon's investigation in the JoJ entry teasing his champion launch. It followed the General's investigation and how he had managed to link the events woven into the Institute of War conspiracy. It was so subtle, it was masterfully done.

I have a strong feeling Riot will stick to this fine narrative when they update his lore. ~~PLEASPLEASEPLEASE~~

I'd love if they modernize it and increase the relationships he has with other champs. Like, even ingame, he barely has any interactions with any other Noxian champions like Kat or Cass. I would love if they branched out his interactions with other Noxian champs in his lore, maybe even Demacian ones like Quinn.

I feel like they are only going to modernize it.

In {{champion:55}}s new lore they mention how Katarina and her dad aren't on good terms anymore and how her father would start to train others instead of her,which sounds to me a lot like {{champion:91}} is going to be Katarinas replacement in the new lore.

And adding to this,the fact that Swain mentions the death/disappearance of Katas dead in his VO,it is likely that this is going to remain canon as well.

The only thing that will likely change is the relationship between him and Katarina.
